verses.text: You shall make an altar for burning incense; you shall make it of acacia wood.
verses.comment: The command to make the incense altar is repeated in Exodus 37:25.

verses.text: It shall be square, one cubit long and one cubit wide, and two cubits high. Its horns shall be of one piece with it.
verses.comment: A cubit is about 18 inches (45 centimeters); horns refer to projections at corners.

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top, its sides all around, and its horns; and you shall make a gold molding all around it.
verses.comment: The gold covering signifies holiness and preciousness.

verses.text: You shall make two gold rings for it under its molding, on two sides. You shall make them on its two sides, for holders for poles with which to carry it.
verses.comment: The rings and poles enable portability for the altar.

verses.text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.comment: Acacia wood is durable; gold overlay maintains uniformity with the altar.

verses.text: You shall put the altar in front of the curtain that is before the Ark of the Testimony, in front of the mercy seat that is above the Ark of the Testimony, where I will meet with you.
verses.comment: Placement indicates proximity to God's presence.

verses.text: Aaron shall burn fragrant incense on it every morning when he tends the lamps.
verses.comment: The lamp maintenance coincided daily with the incense offering.

verses.text: And when Aaron sets up the lamps in the evening, he shall burn incense on it; it shall be a perpetual incense before the LORD throughout your generations.
verses.comment: Perpetual means continual, always ongoing.

verses.text: You shall not offer unauthorized incense on it, or a burnt offering, or a grain offering; and you shall not pour a drink offering on it.
verses.comment: Unauthorized incense refers to any other formula than prescribed.

verses.text: Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonement; once a year he shall make atonement for it throughout your generations. It is most holy to the LORD.
verses.comment: Refers to the annual Day of Atonement ritual.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Major sections usually begin with editorial transition.

verses.text: When you take a census of the Israelites, each shall give a ransom for his life to the LORD when you count them, so that no plague may strike them when you count them.
verses.comment: Paying a ransom for life was a safeguard against divine judgment.

verses.text: Everyone who is counted must give half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs); half a shekel as an offering to the LORD.
verses.comment: Half a shekel is approximately 0.2 ounces (6 grams) of silver.

verses.text: Everyone who crosses over to be counted, from twenty years old and above, shall give the LORD’s offering.
verses.comment: Twenty years old was the age of military and civic responsibility.

verses.text: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when you give the LORD's offering to make atonement for your lives.
verses.comment: This demonstrates equality before God in the atonement payment.

verses.text: You shall take the atonement money from the Israelites and use it for the service of the Tent of Meeting, so that it may be a memorial for the Israelites before the LORD to make atonement for your lives.
verses.comment: Funds were dedicated to Tabernacle upkeep.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Repeats literary structure.

verses.text: You shall make a bronze basin with its stand for washing. You shall put it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it.
verses.comment: Placement indicates ritual purification was required before service.

verses.text: Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet with water from it.
verses.comment: Physical washing symbolized inward purity.

verses.text: When they go into the Tent of Meeting or when they approach the altar to minister, to burn a food offering to the LORD, they shall wash with water so that they will not die.
verses.comment: Washing was necessary to avoid divine judgment.

verses.text: So they shall wash their hands and feet so that they will not die. This shall be a lasting statute for them, for him and his descendants throughout their generations.
verses.comment: Emphasizes permanence of this command for priesthood.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Begins the directions regarding anointing oil.

verses.text: Take the finest spices: five hundred shekels of liquid myrrh, half as much (that is, two hundred fifty shekels) of fragrant cinnamon, two hundred fifty shekels of fragrant cane,
verses.comment: Measurements are based on sanctuary shekel, about 12 pounds (5.5 kg) total.

verses.text: five hundred shekels of cassia, measured by the sanctuary shekel, and a hin of olive oil.
verses.comment: A hin is about one gallon (3.8 liters).

verses.text: You shall make these into a sacred anointing oil, a fragrant blend, the work of a perfumer; it shall be holy anointing oil.
verses.comment: The oil is uniquely formulated and reserved for holy purposes.

verses.text: You shall anoint the Tent of Meeting and the Ark of the Testimony with it,
verses.comment: Anointing symbolized consecration and setting apart for God's use.

verses.text: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and its utensils, and the altar of incense,
verses.comment: All articles in the Tabernacle were anointed and consecrated.

verses.text: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin with its stand.
verses.comment: Completes the list of items to be anointed.

verses.text: You shall consecrate them so they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be holy.
verses.comment: Contact with anointed objects imparted holiness.

verses.text: You shall anoint Aaron and his sons and consecrate them to minister to Me as priests.
verses.comment: Anointing is part of priestly ordination.

verses.text: Say to the Israelites, ‘This shall be My holy anointing oil throughout your generations.’
verses.comment: The formula and use extend to future generations.

verses.text: It shall not be poured on human flesh, and you shall not make any like it, according to its formula; it is holy, and shall be holy to you.
verses.comment: The exclusive use and formula separated sacred from common.

verses.text: Whoever makes any like it or puts any of it on an unauthorized person shall be cut off from his people.
verses.comment: Being 'cut off' means exclusion from the community or divine judgment.

verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, 'Take fragrant spices: stacte, onycha, galbanum—fragrant spices and pure frankincense, in equal amounts;
verses.comment: The identification of stacte, onycha, and galbanum is uncertain but reflects traditional translations.

verses.text: and make incense, a perfume, the work of a perfumer, salted, pure and holy.
verses.comment: Salt symbolizes covenant permanence and preservation.

verses.text: Beat some of it into powder, and place some of it before the Testimony in the Tent of Meeting where I will meet with you. It shall be most holy to you.
verses.comment: Powdering and location stress sacredness.

verses.text: You shall not make incense of this formula for yourselves; it shall be holy to you for the LORD.
verses.comment: Prohibition maintains unique devotion.

verses.text: Whoever makes any like it, to smell, shall be cut off from his people.
verses.comment: Penalty for misusing holy objects repeats principle in verse 33.
